item.title: The Gunslinger (The Dark Tower I)
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The first book in Stephen King’s Magnum Opus series.

item.title: Don't Make Me Think (Revisited): A Common Sense Approach to Web and Mobile Usability
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: A quick, succinct, and helpful primer on the basics of digital usability.

item.title: Burmese Days
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: A sorrowed account of a British soldier’s life in what is now modern day Burma.

item.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The generational tale of one family in South America.

item.title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description:
These are the tales of Dunk and Egg.

A century before Game of Thrones, two unlikely heroes wandered Westeros.

item.title: Armada
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The author of Ready Player One writes another nerd fantasy.

item.title: First They Killed My Father: A Daughter of Cambodia Remembers
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The Cambodian genocide, told through the eyes of a 5-year old girl. A must read.

item.title: The Rebel of Rangoon: A Tale of Defiance and Deliverance in Burma
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: A catalog of Burma’s 40 year quest for freedom, told through the eyes of all those that dedicated their lives to the movement.

item.title: The Alchemist
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: An essential read for anyone at a crossroads in their life.

item.title: The Boys in the Boat: Nine Americans and Their Epic Quest for Gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: A great story of trials and triumph in one of the world’s darkest times. This book sits at the intersection of the 1936 Olympic US Rowing team, the Great Depression, and Hitler’s rise to power.

item.title: Behind the Beautiful Forevers: Life, Death, and Hope in a Mumbai Undercity
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description:
A look into lives of the people living in Bombay’s slumworld.

I suggest anyone who reads this seeks additional stories of India to get a more holistic view of one of the most complex countries on the planet. This story just provides one aspect. India is many things to many people.

item.title: The Blade Itself (The First Law, #1)
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The first book in the First Law fantasy trilogy.

item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: Big Brother is watching.

item.title: Growth Hacker Marketing
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: A brief introduction to a burgeoning field that blends marketing & product for the specific objective of rapid growth.

item.title: The Book of Five Rings
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: Written almost 400 years ago, the Book of Five Rings gives insight and guidance on overcoming struggle and mastering conflict.

item.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: Down the rabbit hole, we go.

item.title: Shantaram
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The unbelievable tale of an Australian convict who escaped a maximum security prison and found refuge on the streets of Bombay.

item.title: The Communist Manifesto
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: A 29-page essay that catalyzed a global political movement.

item.title: Foundation
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The first book of the Foundation series, the flagship epic from the Godfather of Science Fiction.

item.title: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The original tale of the Kansas girl who got swept away to the land of Oz.

item.title: The Art of War
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: One of the oldest warfare strategy manuals, written over 2,500 years ago.

item.title: Peter and Wendy
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The original story of the legendary boy who never grew up.

item.title: Rivers of London Series (5 Books)
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The Rivers of London series, now at 5 books and counting, is what would happen if Sherlock Holmes and Harry Potter had a baby. Murder mysteries in a world very similar to ours, only for the small difference that magic does indeed exist, and our law enforcement is equipped to protect us from its malintentioned practictioners. The writing is sarcastic and witty with a dry sense of humor, and leaves the reader wanting more every time.

item.title: Hooked
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: Hooked is essential reading for any marketer.

item.title: Animal Farm
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: Animal Farm by George Orwell is a fantastic depiction of the rise and fall of Communism in Russia, as told through a group of farm animals.

item.title: Endurance: Shackleton's Incredible Voyage
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: Endurance: Shackleton’s Incredible Voyage details what still stands today as one of the greatest adventures ever undertaken by man.

item.title: If the Buddha Dated: A Handbook for Finding Love on a Spiritual Path
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: A thought-provoking handbook that breaks readers out of the mold of the traditional western mindset of love.

item.title: The 5th Wave
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: It’s not the aliens you should be worried about.

item.title: The Maze Runner (Book 1)
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: The first book in the Maze Runner series. Wicked is good.

item.title: The Girl in the Spider's Web: A Lisbeth Salander Novel
item.author: Sunish Oturkar
item.description: A horrible continuation of the Millennium Series. Stieg Larsson is likely rolling in his grave, regretting the day he ever passed his torch to David Lagercrantz.
